text:
Bird City is a city in Cheyenne County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 447 people lived there.
History.
Bird City was created in 1885. It was named after Benjamin Bird, a cattleman. The area around the city was originally used for livestock grazing.
Bird City was a station and shipping point on the Chicago, Burlington and Quincy Railroad.
Geography.
Bird City is at (39.750950, -101.533480). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Weather.
The Köppen Climate Classification system says that Bird City has a semi-arid climate, abbreviated "BSk" on climate maps.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 447 people, 211 households, and 118 families living in Bird City.
Education.
Bird City is a part of USD 103 Cheylin.
